summary: RE: the dumb fuck complaining about diversity on the Cyberpunk forums, I'm honestly getting my fucking life knowing all these...
question: RE: the dumb fuck complaining about diversity on the Cyberpunk forums, I'm honestly getting my fucking life knowing all these fanboys who latched on to CDPR as the last bastion of Tru Gamerz who would never Pander™️ to those nasty women and gayz are now watching CDPR market Cyberpunk 2077 with the female lead, openly advertise and show off the main (male) character having queer relationships put PoC everywhere. They must feel so fucking betrayed and their impotent nerd rage delights me :)
answer: same fam

reblog.comment: same fam

trail.content_raw: same fam

blog.name: burnt-biscuit
blog.title: This Unit Does Have A Soul

body:
Cyberpunk 2020

Hey, I’m looking for a female player for a Cyberpunk 2020 game. The game will most likely be bi-weekly, take place on Mondays, start at 5PM [PST], and be played in 3 hour sessions. I’m new to DMing the system but have played it for a few months and have been DMing other games for approximately 3 years. I intend to run it in a way evocative of a tv show. We’ll be using Discord for voice chat and Roll20 for character sheets, rolling, and video. Character creation will happen in a Zero Session, along with a table etiquette rundown, and discussion of campaign do/do not wants. Campaign won’t be starting until mid/late October. LGBTQIA+ friendly. IM me for a link to the application/Roll20 listing.

summary:
Holla out ya city if you'd ride for it Let 'em know why you'd die for it

 

And when the stash low and it ain't no cash flow...
body:
Holla out ya city if you’d ride for it
Let ‘em know why you’d die for it

And when the stash low and it ain’t no cash flow
Shit, I go to work, move it by the boat load 

Independent, semi-selective ‘V’ from Projekt Red’s Cyberpunk 2077. Hacked by Rose.
